Inferring trajectories with SCORPIUS

Source: R/ti_scorpius.R
scorpius.Rd

Arguments passed to this function will be used as default parameters for the method.

description_scorpius(distance_method = "spearman", ndim = 3L, k = 4L,
  thresh = 0.001, maxit = 10L, stretch = 0, smoother = "smooth.spline",
  sparse = FALSE)

description_scorpius_sparse(distance_method = "spearman", ndim = 3L,
  k = 4L, thresh = 0.001, maxit = 10L, stretch = 0,
  smoother = "smooth.spline", sparse = TRUE)

Arguments

ndim

The number of dimensions in the new space.
k

The number of clusters to cluster the data into.
thresh

principal.curve parameter: convergence threshhold on shortest distances to the curve
maxit

principal.curve parameter: maximum number of iterations
stretch

principal.curve parameter: a factor by which the curve can be extrapolated when points are projected
smoother

principal.curve parameter: choice of smoother
sparse

Whether or not to use sparse MDS dimensionality reduction, for datasets with large amounts of cells.

Contents

  • Arguments
